name: Who Is The Phantom Stranger? Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the frequent reluctant ally of the Phantom Stranger?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Thirteen.

	Doctor Terrence Thirteen has dedicated his life to disproving any and all kinds of magic phenomenon. To his great disappointment, his daughter Traci is a magician. The good doctor first appeared in 1952's "Star-Spangled Comics" #52.

questions.text: In the story "When Ghosts Walk", where is the doomed airplane headed?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco.

	This story appeared in the first issue of "The Phantom Stranger", which went on sale in 1969. Three men are traveling to San Francisco for very different reasons, but are killed when the plane goes down. A vile criminal pretended to be the ghosts of the men in order to frighten innocent people!

questions.text: What is the name of the girl who lived for five thousand years?
questions.explanation:
Tateeka.

	Tateeka and her father tricked several men out of plenty of money! Using mind-altering drugs, Tateeka would charge men a hefty one thousand dollars to go on a date with her. Luckily, Doctor Thirteen saw through this ruse in 1969's second issue of "The Phantom Stranger".

questions.text: To con his brother out of his income, whom did Jay Cahill dress up as?
questions.explanation:
Vasti, the fortuneteller.

	In the third issue of "The Phantom Stranger", debuting in October of 1969, both the Phantom Stranger and Doctor Thirteen investigate a circus where disasters are threatening to put the establishment out of business. It turns out that the owner's brother was trying, as always, to rob him.

questions.text: In "There is Laughter in Hell This Day", who is being worshipped?
questions.explanation:
Tala.

	Tala is the evil nemesis of The Phantom Stranger. He appears to defeat her over and over again, but she constantly reminds him that she will always be back to challenge him again. This story appeared in the fourth issue of "The Phantom Stranger", which debuted in November of 1969.

questions.text: In the fifth issue of the series, who is NOT one of the teenagers?
questions.explanation:
"Wild" Rice.

	Mister Square, Spartacus, Wild Rose, and Attila are a group of teenagers who get involved in several adventures with Doctor Thirteen and the Phantom Stranger. Rose even danced with a dead man! Issue #5 went on sale in January of 1970.

questions.text: In the sixth issue of the series, which object flies out the door of the thirteenth house on Thirteen Street?
questions.explanation:
A clock.

	"The Phantom Stranger" #6 went on sale in March of 1970. The four teenagers seek to investigate, only to get tangled up in the ongoing fight between Doctor Thirteen and the Phantom Stranger.

questions.text: In the seventh issue of the series, who saves the four teenagers from drowning?
questions.explanation:
Phantom Stranger.

	During a storm, Tala decides to use her powers to rend the sail from the teens' boat, leaving them to a watery grave. The Phantom Stranger dives to the depth of the water to save them. The issue debuted in May 1970.

questions.text: In the eighth issue of the series, what kind of giants were featured on the cover?
questions.explanation:
Ice giants.

	How could giants be made out of wind? The issue went on sale in August of 1970. Giants always seem to pop up as enemies in comic books. Can they never be portrayed in a positive light?

questions.text: In the ninth issue of the series, what weapon is used to foretell death?
questions.explanation:
A spear.

	The Obeah Man wanted the President's secretary dead, so he sent his spear as a warning. Doctor Thirteen is called, and the Phantom Stranger also makes an appearance to decode this disturbing situation. The issue went on sale in October of 1970.
